results.title: The Fugitive
results.creator_credit: Andrew Davis, Arnold Kopelson, Keith Barish and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Fugitive, one of the most popular television series of the 1960’s was brought to the screen with Harrison Ford playing the role of Doctor Richard Kimble. Kimble, a Chicago surgeon, is falsely accused of murdering his wife. Convicted of the crime, he escapes from custody to pursue an unknown one-armed man, whom he knows is the killer. Hot on his trail is Sam Gerard, US Marshall, (Tommy Lee Jones), who won an Academy Award for this performance. Andrew Davis as director has created a thrilling, action-packed film which moves at a hectic pace towards the final moment when Kimble meets his man.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Davis, Arnold Kopelson, Keith Barish and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: The Frustrating fours and fascinating fives [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Judith Crawley, National Film Board of Canada and Crawley Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ages and Stages”.
A study of the behavior of four-and-five-year-old children at home and at nursery school. At four the vacillation between infantile helplessness and vigorous self-assertion is seen, and at five the development of independence and the beginning of cooperation. Parents observe that, unpredictable as their behavior may be, it’s fun to help in the development of the fours and fives.

results.title: The Frustrated Colussus
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sweat of the sun, tears of the moon”.
Argentina was once the tenth richest nation in the world and Argentinians consider themselves the most educated, most civilised people in South America where what counts is style. But how close to reality is this self-image of Argentinians? To answer this question, Jack Pizzey investigates the macho gaucho tradition, the tango, the influence of Italian and British immigrants, the personality cult of Juan and Evita Peron, the hideous torture and death squads of the 70’s and the debacle of the Falklands War. What he discovers is a country where self-delusion is the national pastime, a developed nation in the process of becoming undeveloped.

results.title: The Fruits of passion = Les Fruits de la passion (E)
results.creator_credit: Shuji Terayama, Hiroko Govaers, Anatole Dauman, Terayama Productions and Argos Films
results.brief_description: A sexually explicit drama, “The Fruits of passion” is the sequel to “The Story of O”. Set in Hong Kong, 1920, the wealthy Sir Stephen is owner of a casino and living in delightful decadence, indulging in a multitude of amorous experiences. Stephen persuades his wife O to join him there and work in a brothel, as a means of demonstrating her love for him. Once there she is exposed to all manner of sexual peccadillos and perversions, frequently enacted whilst Stephen watches. Stephen embarks upon an affair with another woman, whilst O finds a new love of her own, challenging their marriage. “The Fruits of passion” is art-house fare that dabbles in soft porn, with a political backdrop. Although it toys with the themes of fidelity and eroticism, the film tends toward misogyny and spends an inordinate amount of time on the sexual proclivities of its protagonists but little on their mental states or emotional motivations. Based on the novel by Pauline Reage (aka Dominique Aury), who wrote the erotic classic, “The Story of O”. Warning - strong sexual content.

results.title: The Frozen flame
results.brief_description: When natural gas is cooled to minus 161 degrees centigrade it becomes a liquid: liquified natural gas, or LNG. In 1959, Shell participated in the first ocean crossing of a cargo of LNG, marking the genesis of the modern LNG industry. In this video, projects in Brunei, Japan, Malaysia and Australia illustrate Shell’s history in the LNG business across management, finance, shipping and supply.

results.title: The Frog princess
results.creator_credit: Paul N Peroff and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: An animated film which tells the story of a prince in search of a bride. He shoots an arrow into the air with the intention of marrying whoever finds it. But it is found by a frog, who is really an enchanted princess. Together they have many adventures until she is released from the spell.

results.title: The Frog prince (Muppets)
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, Robert Lawrence Productions and Henson Associates
results.brief_description: Sir Robin, the bravest prince is turned into a frog by an ogre. The only cure to revert him to his human form is to receive a kiss from a Princess, to lift the spell. Starring Trudy Young as the Princess and Gordon Thomson as the Prince, as well as the muppet performers.

results.title: The Frog Prince
results.brief_description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

results.description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955: others include The Gallant Little Tailor, Hänsel and Gretel, Sleeping Beauty and Snow White and Rose Red.
description_for_label: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955: others include The Gallant Little Tailor, Hänsel and Gretel, Sleeping Beauty and Snow White and Rose Red.
